item.title: Analyse Asia 84: The Five Predictions on Asia in 2016 with Sameer Singh
item.description: The 5 Predictions on the Technology Landscape in Asia 2016
item.dc:creator: Unknown
item.itunes:author: Unknown
item.itunes:subtitle: The 5 Predictions on the Technology Landscape in Asia 2016
item.itunes:summary:
‚ñ≤ 5 | The 5 Predictions on the Technology Landscape in Asia 2016

Comments

Bernard Leong: Episode Synopsis: Starting the new year, Sameer Singh, author of Tech-Thoughts.net and our host Bernard Leong discussed the five predictions on Asia technology landscape 2016 in the second part of the two-episodes arc. Building on their earlier conversation on the five major events that rocked 2015, they forecast the events in 2016 which will shape the technology landscape of Asia as it is becoming the new battleground for the US companies as well as the homegrown Asian giants in the next few decades.

item.title: I Was There Too - Meet Dave with Paul Scheer
item.description: Actors who had tiny roles in big movies share their stories
item.dc:creator: Unknown
item.itunes:author: Unknown
item.itunes:subtitle: Actors who had tiny roles in big movies share their stories
item.itunes:summary:
‚ñ≤ 3 | Actors who had tiny roles in big movies share their stories

Comments

Alex Carter: In a very special episode-long segment of I Wasn‚Äôt There Too, actor, writer, and Wolfpop‚Äôs own Paul Scheer joins Matt to talk about his experience on the set of Meet Dave. Paul goes deep into how his role of Lieutenant Buttocks got re-cast during shooting, being fooled by Eddie Murphy doubles, and the wonderful rapport the real Eddie Murphy had with everyone on set. Plus, Paul tells us about one of his very first auditions for the Tom Cruise film Vanilla Sky.

item.title: Work Smart #26 - Global exec at Houzz and 7x Entrepreneur, Tom Clayton
item.description: If you‚Äôre going to make the jump, mitigate risk!
item.dc:creator: Unknown
item.itunes:author: Unknown
item.itunes:subtitle: If you‚Äôre going to make the jump, mitigate risk!
item.itunes:summary:
‚ñ≤ 3 | If you‚Äôre going to make the jump, mitigate risk!

Comments

Ray Gillenwater: "If you‚Äôre going to make the jump, mitigate as many risks as possible"

Start off 2016 with a dose of inspiration from Tom Clayton - former Founder and CEO of Bubbly, 7x entrepreneur and current head of global expansion at Houzz.
Topics covered:
-Why being extremely organized is the ultimate work smart tip
-The importance of 1 on 1s - even on big teams
-Mixing work & pleasure to make sure you have time for both
-The scrappy no-ego, no-politics culture at Houzz
-Tom's journey from 1st time entrepreneur to tech exec

-----

item.title: This American Life - The Problem We All Live With
item.description: Examining racism in the public school system
item.dc:creator: Unknown
item.itunes:author: Unknown
item.itunes:subtitle: Examining racism in the public school system
item.itunes:summary:
‚ñ≤ 18 | Examining racism in the public school system

Comments

bryancolligan: I love how they just slide in there this is the school district Michael Brown is from.... Really raises awareness of the environment where something like Fergueson can happen.

Adam Muller: great post, @alexcartaz. Excellent and important episode. Great stuff.

Alex Carter: Right now, all sorts of people are trying to rethink and reinvent education, to get poor minority kids performing as well as white kids. But there's one thing nobody tries anymore, despite lots of evidence that it works: desegregation. Nikole Hannah-Jones looks at a district that, not long ago, accidentally launched a desegregation program. First of a two-part series.

item.title: Fresh Air - Larry Wilmore / SNL‚Äôs Colin Jost & Michael Che
item.description: Part 1 of Fresh Air's best interviews of 2015
item.dc:creator: Unknown
item.itunes:author: Unknown
item.itunes:subtitle: Part 1 of Fresh Air's best interviews of 2015
item.itunes:summary:
‚ñ≤ 14 | Part 1 of Fresh Air's best interviews of 2015

Comments

Alex Carter: I really enjoyed this episode. Terry Gross is my favorite interviewer and @larrywilmore was a great guest, from talking about following Jon Stewart's advice to be himself not a host (while hosting The Nightly Show), to discovering he's been a feminist his whole life and not realizing it until now, to using logic and wit to tear down racism. üôå

Matt Williamson: Episode notes:

"As part of our Best of 2015 series we listen back to our interview with Larry Wilmore. The host of Comedy Central‚Äôs ‚ÄòNightly Show‚Äô says it took a few months ‚Äî and some advice from Jon Stewart ‚Äî for him to get comfortable in his new role. Also, Saturday Night Live ‚ÄòWeekend Update‚Äô co-anchors Colin Jost and Michael Che talk about working with Trump, the perils of cue cards, and how they got started in comedy."

item.title: The Twenty Minute VC: Sitar Teli, Managing Partner @ Connect Ventures
item.description: How to say no fast and efficiently as a VC
item.dc:creator: Sitar Teli, Harry Stebbings
item.itunes:author: Sitar Teli, Harry Stebbings
item.itunes:subtitle: How to say no fast and efficiently as a VC
item.itunes:summary:
‚ñ≤ 6 | How to say no fast and efficiently as a VC

Comments

Harry Stebbings: Sitar Teli is Managing Partner at Connect Ventures and has been a venture capitalist for eight years, focusing on early-stage investments in both consumer and B2B companies. Previously with Doughty Hanson Technology Ventures, where she led their Series A round in SoundCloud, she has experience with content, gaming and ecommerce startups. Sitar has a dual degree in Mechanical Engineering and Economics from Duke University.

In Today's Episode You Will Learn:

1.) How did Sitar make her way into the wonderful world of VC?

2.) How does Sitar approach the difficult task of saying no to entrepreneurs? What is the framework she has adopted over her 8 years in venture?
3.) There are a large amount of sources of capital for business in the seed stage, why did Sitar believe this was the stage with the most opportunity? Is too much capital chasing too few deals?

4.) With the increasing prominence of crowdfunding, is it a viable alternative to VC? Is Sitar concerned that quality deal flow is being lost to Crowdfunding?

5.) What is driving the growth of the European tech startup scene?

6.) Prior to making investments such as that of Citymapper, one obviously has to look at the team and the product. So what do you look for in a founder and what to you makes a great product?

Items Mentioned In Today's Episode:

Sitar's Fave Book: The Amazing Adventures of Kavalier and Clay
Sitar's Fave Blog or Newsletter: Benedict Evans Newsletter
Sitar's Fave Apps: Outlook, Sunrise, Citymapper
Sitar's Most Recent Investment: Knyttan

item.title: Analyse Asia 83: The Five Major Events in Asia 2015 with Sameer Singh
item.description: 5 most Important Events in Asia Technology Landscape in 2015
item.dc:creator: Bernard Leong
item.itunes:author: Bernard Leong
item.itunes:subtitle: 5 most Important Events in Asia Technology Landscape in 2015
item.itunes:summary:
‚ñ≤ 5 | 5 most Important Events in Asia Technology Landscape in 2015

Comments

Bernard Leong: Episode Synopsis: Sameer Singh, author of Tech-Thoughts.net and senior industry analysis manager of App Annie, joined our host in a two episodes arc discussion on the five major events that shook Asia for the year of 2015 and the predictions for the year of 2016. In the first part, we discuss the five major events in Asia this year: (a) the surge of venture capital financing in Asia and its implications, (b) SoftBank‚Äôs Pepper with Alibaba and Foxconn, (c) the Nintendo-DeNA deal, (d) Xiaomi‚Äôs challenging year and (e) global recognition of Wechat‚Äôs messaging platform and why Facebook is learning from them to build their messaging app. We also added a short discussion on the upcoming dawn of self-driving cars and examine its implications across Asia from the on-demand taxi-hailing apps, the investors such as SoftBank and Tiger Global and the car makers.

item.title: HomeHero - Kiel Dowlin
item.description: Healthcare industry insights and innovations
item.dc:creator: Mike Townsend
item.itunes:author: Mike Townsend
item.itunes:subtitle: Healthcare industry insights and innovations
item.itunes:summary:
‚ñ≤ 4 | Healthcare industry insights and innovations

Comments

Alex Carter: I first found out about @HomeHero and @kaleazy from listening to @jason's This Week in Startups. So cool that they have a podcast of their own now!

Alex Carter: This is the first episode of HomeHero's podcast. Kiel Dowlin has years of experience at companies such as Castlight Health and Cambia Health Solutions, and brings a wealth of insider knowledge about the healthcare system to today‚Äôs show.

This episode discusses:
-Which areas of healthcare are seeing the most innovation and change in 2015
-How industry newcomers bring fresh perspective, solutions to the healthcare industry
-Technology‚Äôs role in the future of healthcare
-The importance of reducing readmissions to bring down healthcare costs
-The distinction between patient outcomes and patient experience

Mike Townsend: @alexcartaz Thanks for posting Alex! We're looking for new guests...
